title: Trump's plane makes U-turn: US President's flight to Davos returns midair — what went wrong?
content: Air Force One, carrying President Trump, made an unexpected return to Joint Base Andrews due to a minor electrical issue mid-flight. The President and his team will board a different aircraft to continue their journey to Davos for the World Economic Forum. The White House confirmed the decision was made out of an abundance of caution.

title: India’s leading vaulters fined by the railways for carrying ‘poles’; stranded for hours
content: National record holder Dev Meena and his teammates were delayed for hours at Panvel station, missing their train to Bhopal. Railway officials demanded a penalty for their pole vault equipment, deeming them 'steel pipes'. Despite explaining their athlete status, the team paid a fine and incurred extra travel costs, causing significant inconvenience.

title: Watch: Danish MP abuses Trump in EU speech; uses 'F' bomb that 'Mr President might understand'
content: A Danish lawmaker in the European Parliament used strong language to condemn US President Donald Trump's interest in Greenland. The President has repeatedly expressed a desire to bring the Arctic territory under American control. This move has sparked concerns about Greenland's sovereignty among European representatives. The lawmaker's outburst reflects growing frustration over Trump's public pressure on the issue.

title: Cigarette in hand, cruising at 120kmph: 4 teens killed in horrific car crash — video
content: A tragic collision on Udaipur's old Ahmedabad bypass claimed the lives of four teenagers and injured six others. The accident occurred when a car, reportedly speeding and with a distracted driver, collided with another vehicle.  A video captured moments before the crash shows passengers urging the driver to slow down, raising concerns about reckless driving.

title: A new low for rupee! Currency falls 31 paise to 91.28 against US dollar
content: The Indian rupee hit a new low of 91.20 against the US dollar on Wednesday, extending its downward trend. This depreciation is attributed to strong dollar demand from metal importers, continued foreign fund outflows, and geopolitical uncertainties. The domestic stock market's sluggish performance also contributed to the rupee's decline.

title: 'ChatGPT is dying': Legendary investor says $500B company faces collapse — read his 600-word note
content: Veteran investor George Noble warns OpenAI is "falling apart" despite its $500 billion valuation. He cites internal "Code Red" alerts, declining ChatGPT traffic, massive quarterly losses of $12 billion, and unsustainable costs for tools like Sora. Key departures and Elon Musk's lawsuit further highlight significant internal turmoil and financial strain.

title: T20 WC: 'No sense' - Pakistan questioned for halting prep in support of B'desh
content: Reports claiming Pakistan has halted T20 World Cup 2026 preparations in support of Bangladesh have been dismissed by former cricketers. Kamran Akmal called the idea illogical, stressing no official PCB or government statement exists. Basit Ali said any decision depends on the government and noted broadcasters would oppose withdrawal, especially due to the India–Pakistan match. The issue stems from Bangladesh’s refusal to play in India over security concerns.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 trades below 25,100; BSE Sensex down over 690 points
content: Indian equity benchmarks Nifty50 and BSE Sensex opened lower on Wednesday, mirroring global weakness driven by escalating US-Europe trade tensions and Trump's policies. Analysts anticipate a short-term technical rebound due to oversold conditions, advising caution and a wait-and-watch approach for stability.

title: Watch: Vande Bharat Sleeper littered hours after inaugural run
content: India's first Vande Bharat sleeper train, designed for faster overnight travel, faced immediate criticism after a video emerged showing litter scattered across a coach shortly after its inaugural run. The incident sparked widespread social media commentary on the lack of civic sense among some passengers.

title: Sulaiman Khan Ghori exit: Engineer leaves xAI after podcast; sparks firing speculation
content: Former xAI engineer Sulaiman Khan Ghori has departed the company, sparking speculation he was "fired" for being "too candid" during a podcast interview. Ghori discussed xAI's rapid development, novel architectures like "Macro Hard," and innovative deployment strategies, including using Tesla computers for "human emulators."

title: IND vs NZ: 'Why do we praise Rohit and Dhoni?' - Gill's captaincy under fire
content: India’s ODI series loss to New Zealand has put captain Shubman Gill’s leadership under scrutiny. Former spinner R Ashwin said India lacked clarity in using bowling resources during crucial middle overs. Comparing Gill to Rohit Sharma and MS Dhoni, Ashwin felt India failed to apply timely pressure, questioned Kuldeep Yadav’s limited use, and suggested Gill appeared cautious under pressure with no clear backup plan.

title: Trump tariffs fallout: Trump’s angry call to Jeff Bezos; Amazon CEO Andy Jassy breaks silence
content: Amazon's plan to highlight tariff costs sparked a call from a reportedly 'pissed' Donald Trump to Jeff Bezos. Months later, CEO Andy Jassy confirms rising prices due to tariffs, with some sellers absorbing costs while others pass them on. The White House labeled Amazon's move a 'hostile act'.

title: ‘Will kill you’: Gurgaon doctor reverses, accelerates, runs over Swiggy rider thrice
content: A 41-year-old Ayurvedic doctor was arrested for attempting to murder a Swiggy delivery rider in Gurgaon. The doctor, Naveen, repeatedly rammed his SUV into the rider, Tinku, after a dispute over parking. CCTV footage captured the shocking incident, leading to Naveen's arrest and the seizure of his vehicle.

title: Aastha Shah says vitiligo ‘is not something tragic, contagious: Exclusive
content: Beauty influencer Aastha Shah, living with vitiligo, shares her journey of self-acceptance and finding worth beyond societal standards. She emphasizes that her condition is not tragic and doesn't define her. Shah's decision to embrace her skin publicly, supported by her family, has empowered her and inspired many to live authentically and reject external validation.

title: Pvt builder estates vs govt projects: Which is a better option for buying home property
content: Once government housing projects were highly sought after, but buyer preferences have shifted. Private developers now offer better planning, amenities, and security, enhancing daily comfort and community life. While government projects remain vital for affordability, private estates provide a superior living experience and investment potential for those who can afford it.

title: 'Our refineries are robust!': India can process Venezuelean crude oil when available
content: Indian Oil Corporation is ready to process Venezuelan crude if supplies resume, recalling past imports.  The company's robust refineries can handle the oil, according to its chairman.  This comes amid geopolitical shifts and India's strong economic growth, which attracts global business interest.  IOCL continues to invest in the energy sector.

title: Karnataka 'sleaze' video row: Parameshwara calls conduct ‘unacceptable’; DGP may be dismissed
content: Karnataka Home Minister G Parameshwara stated that the state government swiftly suspended DGP K Ramachandra Rao following unverified sleaze videos, deeming such acts unacceptable. He emphasized that disciplinary action was initiated regardless of seniority, with potential dismissal if charges are proven true. The minister also addressed opposition criticism, asserting that the law will take its course in all matters.

title: 'Rules-based order a fiction': Canadian PM admits West excused US hegemony
content: In a major confession from a Western leader against the unbridled and unchecked American hegemony, the Canadian PM said the Western nations "avoided calling out the gaps between rhetoric and reality" as the American hegemony helped provide public goods. Carney, without naming US president Donald Trump, who have been hostile towards Canada ​ever before assuming office a year ago, tore into the Republican leader, saying: "You cannot live within the lie of mutual benefit through integration when integration becomes the source of your subordination."

title: End of an era: Sunita Williams retires after 600+ days in space, 3 ISS missions
content: Nasa astronaut Sunita Williams has retired after 27 years. She completed three missions on the International Space Station and set records for spacewalks and time in orbit. Williams' career included space shuttle flights and a recent test flight on Boeing's Starliner. Her contributions pave the way for future space exploration.

title: ‘You’ll struggle to remember’: Manjrekar explains ‘WC’ theory; backs Gambhir
content: Sanjay Manjrekar defended coach Gautam Gambhir after India’s ODI series loss to New Zealand, urging fans not to overreact. He said bilateral ODIs hold little value today and are often forgotten quickly. Manjrekar stressed that only World Cups truly matter in 50-over cricket and that poor results in smaller series can help teams reset before major tournaments.

title: Prostate cancer symptoms that mimic common age-related problems: Doctor shares warning signs
content: Prostate cancer is a growing concern in India, often missed due to subtle symptoms mistaken for aging. Early signs like frequent urination or blood in urine are frequently ignored. This lack of awareness and discussion delays diagnosis. Experts urge men over 40 to undergo regular check-ups, especially with a family history, to ensure early detection and successful treatment.

title: Delhi-NCR air remains toxic: AQI at 341 in ‘very poor’ zone; GRAP-4 lifted
content: On Wednesday, Delhi-NCR was engulfed by a dense layer of smog, as the Air Quality Index soared to 341, marking it as 'very poor' yet again. Following a weekend where air quality neared 'severe' conditions, the situation has slightly improved; however, many neighborhoods continue to experience alarming 'severe' levels of pollution.

title: 'Dhurandhar' inches closer to Rs 1,300 crore mark
content: 'Dhurandhar' continues its impressive box office run, holding strong even in its seventh week. The spy thriller, starring Ranveer Singh and Akshaye Khanna, has defied expectations by maintaining a steady graph and setting a new record for highest seventh-week collections for a Hindi film. Despite a dip, it leads over other releases.

title: Noida techie death case: Realtor who owned plot held; SIT probes failed rescue
content: In a shocking turn of events, the director of Wiztown Planners is now in custody following the tragic death of a software engineer in a flooded trench on company property. Authorities have swiftly established an investigation team to delve into the circumstances surrounding this incident, leading to the removal of the CEO of the Noida Authority.

title: T20 WC: India's prep enters home stretch; NZ series final chance to test combinations
content: India face a resurgent New Zealand in a T20 series, a crucial test for the T20 World Cup squad. Captain Suryakumar Yadav seeks to regain form amidst batting concerns, while Ishan Kishan is set to bat at number three. New Zealand, buoyed by recent successes, aims for a T20 hat-trick against India.

title: AIBE twice a year, final-year students allowed: The Supreme Court just fixed a timing mess
content: India’s bar exam pathway is getting a long-overdue timing fix. The Bar Council of India has told the Supreme Court it has framed new rules allowing final-semester LLB students to sit for the All India Bar Examination, while making the test a twice-a-year exercise. The condition remains clear: students can appear, but must clear their final exams to move forward. For aspirants, this is not just a procedural update—it reduces the risk of losing an entire year to exam cycles and paperwork, and smoothens the jump from law school to practice.

title: Spain: Train derails in Barcelona days after high-speed rail collision; 1 killed, 37 injured
content: A commuter train derailed near Barcelona after a retaining wall collapsed due to heavy rain, killing the driver and injuring 37 people. Emergency services responded swiftly, evacuating passengers and treating the injured. This incident follows a separate deadly rail crash in southern Spain earlier in the week.

title: Wall Street tumbles! Dow sheds 850 points, S&P 500 slips 2% after Trump's Greenland bid
content: Global markets experienced a significant downturn Tuesday, with US indices suffering their worst day in three months following President Trump's new tariff threats against Europe. This sparked a broad sell-off, pushing gold higher and impacting Bitcoin. Indian markets also mirrored the global decline, with both Nifty and Sensex falling over 1%.

title: 100 stray dogs poisoned near Hyderabad after 500 culled in Telangana
content: Another 100 stray dogs were allegedly poisoned in Yacharam village, Rangareddy district, sparking outrage among animal welfare activists. This incident follows the mass killing of over 500 dogs in Telangana. Police have registered a case against the village sarpanch and two others, with investigations underway to locate the buried carcasses.

title: ‘Questioned over 40 pending death claims’: Colleague sets woman on fire in LIC building; AAO arrested
content: A shocking pre-planned murder disguised as a fire accident has been uncovered in Madurai. An LIC officer, Kalyani Nambi, was tragically killed when her colleague, D Ram, set her ablaze. Ram confessed to the crime, motivated by a dispute over pending death claims. He attempted to stage the incident as an accident.

title: Budget 2026 expectations: Next phase of financial growth is affordable, smarter credit
content: Budget 2026 expectations: India does not need a larger financial system. It needs a system where liquidity is deeper.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for January 21 - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Mehul Kothari of Anand Rathi Shares and Stock Brokers recommends buying Bajaj Auto, Balkrishna Industries, and Tata Elxsi as top stock picks for today:

title: New BJP chief: On Day 1, Nitin Nabin targets rivals in poll-bound TN
content: Nitin Nabin, in his first address as BJP national president, urged party workers to defend Sanatan faith and its legacy, stating that parties opposing traditions like 'deepam' in Madurai or Ram Setu have no place in politics. He also encouraged youth to actively participate in politics, viewing it as a long-term commitment.

title: T20 WC: 'Are you sure?' - Bangladesh captain makes shocking admission
content: Bangladesh captain Litton Das questioned his team’s T20 World Cup participation after Rangpur Riders’ BPL exit, criticising slow pitches and saying, “Are you sure we are going to play in the World Cup?” He confirmed the BCB has not discussed the issue with him. The uncertainty follows Bangladesh rejecting ICC conditions to play in India, amid an unresolved venue dispute and a looming February 7 tournament start.

title: Union minister rules out trade talks at WEF, assures India's engagement on other fronts
content: Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw clarified that the World Economic Forum in Davos serves as a platform for idea exchange, not formal trade negotiations. India is actively engaged with global economies on various fronts, and its economic growth and renewable energy initiatives are key discussion points at the event.

title: Donna Kelce urges Travis Kelce and Taylor Swift to start a family amid wedding delay
content: Travis Kelce is feeling family pressure after his brother Jason revealed that their mother, Donna Kelce, wants him and Taylor Swift to have children soon. The conversation surfaced on the New Heights podcast, where Donna’s preference was openly discussed. While Travis joked about it, the comments sparked fresh buzz about baby plans as the couple slows wedding preparations.

title: 'Very excited': Second lady Usha Vance announces pregnancy; Vances to welcome fourth child
content: Vice President JD Vance and second lady Usha Vance are expecting their fourth child. The baby boy is due in late July. Usha Vance and the baby are healthy. This marks a significant moment as she is the first vice presidential spouse to be pregnant while her husband is in office. The couple expressed gratitude for their support system.

title: Voluntary contributions to BJP up 54% to Rs 6,125cr in 2024-25
content: The BJP's voluntary contributions surged by 54% to Rs 6,125 crore in 2024-25, significantly exceeding the Rs 1,686 crore earned via electoral bonds in the previous year. This increase, driven by a near three-fold rise in corporate donations, offset the loss of anonymous funding.

title: Rule change: Lok Sabha MPs can mark attendance only from their seats
content: Lok Sabha MPs must now mark attendance from their designated seats during functioning hours, a change effective from the upcoming Budget session. Speaker Om Birla announced this reform to ensure attendance reflects active participation, not just presence within Parliament. This move aims to boost discipline and productivity in legislative proceedings.

title: Shane Lowry’s net worth: The relentless rise of Ireland’s major champion
content: Shane Lowry's career is a testament to hard work, patience, and clutch performances. From an amateur Irish Open win to lifting The Open Championship trophy, he has become a reliable force on both the PGA Tour and DP World Tour. His consistent success, including recent strong showings and a record-tying 62, underscores his enduring talent and dedication.

title: Sources: McDaniel set to become Chargers OC
content: Former Miami Dolphins head coach Mike McDaniel is expected to become the Los Angeles Chargers' offensive coordinator, sources told ESPN.

title: Mets continue overhaul, land OF Robert in trade
content: Luis Robert Jr., a former Gold Glover who hit 38 home runs two seasons ago, is headed to the Mets in a trade that sends infielder Luisangel Acuna and right-hander Truman Pauley to the White Sox.

title: Beltran, A. Jones elected to Baseball Hall of Fame
content: Carlos Beltran and Andruw Jones, center fielders who excelled at the plate and with their gloves, were voted into the Baseball Hall of Fame.

title: Mayfield takes swipe at ex-coach Stefanski in post
content: Buccaneers quarterback Baker Mayfield jabbed at new Falcons coach Kevin Stefanski, saying, "Can't wait to see you twice a year, Coach."

title: Harbaugh: Too much focus on Giants' hierarchy
content: New Giants coach John Harbaugh said too much is being made of who has more power to make decisions and that it's important that he and GM Joe Schoen work together.

title: Dubs don't envision Butler trade despite ACL tear
content: Warriors GM Mike Dunleavy told reporters he has no plans to move Jimmy Butler's contract at the trade deadline, despite the veteran forward suffering a season-ending ACL tear.

title: Former Bama standout sues NCAA over eligibility
content: Charles Bediako, who entered the 2023 NBA draft and played in the G League, has sued the NCAA to gain reinstatement to join the Crimson Tide.

title: Duke sues QB Mensah, tries to prevent transfer
content: Duke sued QB Darian Mensah on Tuesday, and a judge denied a request for a temporary restraining order that would have prevented him from entering the transfer portal.

title: Baseball Hall of Fame voting winners, losers and who could get in next
content: The results are in! Our experts break down the highs and lows of the 2026 vote and look ahead to 2027.

title: 8-8 in the playoffs with Josh Allen? Buffalo fired Sean McDermott, but there's more blame to go around
content: With postseason losses piling up, the Bills fired McDermott. But will it change anything? And where did things go wrong?

title: Men's Bracketology: Don't write off Houston just yet
content: The Cougars remain national title contenders despite falling off the radar at the turn of the calendar year.

title: Women's Bracketology: Big nonconference win boosts Ohio State to a 3-seed
content: Results Sunday and Monday shook up the top 16, and the Buckeyes benefited the most, climbing two seed lines.

title: NBA midseason debate: Are the Thunder in trouble? Can the Clippers really climb in the West?
content: ESPN analysts Zach Kram and Kevin Pelton break down the league's biggest storylines from leading challengers to surprise contenders.

title: NBA All-Star rosters: Starters, snubs and biggest questions
content: Who was the biggest surprise or snub? Which superstar duo are we most excited to see? Experts break it down.

title: 'Obviously, we would have a great team': What Russian NHLers are saying about missing the Olympics
content: Russia is suspended from international competition due to the war in Ukraine, sidelining many who'd otherwise be playing.

title: NFL execs predict 2026 moves: Lamar Jackson, A.J. Brown trades coming?
content: We asked NFL executives to make bold predictions about this offseason and next season. Could we see two superstar trades?

title: Let's overreact to divisional round games: Pause Stroud's extension talks?
content: Hold off on any new Stroud deals? No Super Bowl yet again for Buffalo? Let's make sense of the games.

title: Way-Too-Early Top 25: Sizing up the top contenders for next season
content: Who will raise the national championship trophy this time next year? We break down the teams to watch.

title: CFP takeaways: Even as a favored Goliath, Indiana's win stands alone in sports history
content: Put it next to the Miracle on Ice or NC State and Villanova. In a wild title game, here's how Indiana beat Miami.

title: Wetzel: Hoosiers delivered a national title for the everyman
content: Curt Cignetti's relentless group of discards and misfits showed what the transfer portal made possible.

title: Vinícius Júnior roars back into form, much to the Bernabéu's delight
content: It's been a rollercoaster of a week for Real Madrid, but a convincing win over Monaco in the Champions League has allowed them to go back on track.

title: Between Gabriel Jesus and Gyökeres, Arsenal's striker battle is heating up
content: Gabriel Jesus and Viktor Gyökeres each staked their claims to Arsenal's No. 9 spot in their win over Inter Milan.

title: USMNT World Cup big board 4.0: Pochettino's roster coming into focus
content: We're less than five months away from the USMNT's World Cup opener, and with the clock ticking down, Mauricio Pochettino's squad is coming into focus.

title: The Caleb throw, a controversial call and plenty of mistakes: Barnwell sizes up 11 divisional round plays
content: Let's sort out Caleb Williams' wild fourth-quarter TD throw, the Broncos' controversial INT, a big Seattle kickoff return TD, a C.J. Stroud pick-six and more.

title: Are Patriots QB Drake Maye's turnovers an issue against the Broncos?
content: The Broncos' defense is the best in the league at getting to the quarterback. How will the Patriots respond?

title: Could this be Novak Djokovic's best shot at a record 25th major title?
content: Djokovic has lost just six matches at the Australian Open in 19 years. If he's going to break the majors record, this would be the time.

title: Does bringing in a 'caretaker manager' work? Will Man United and Real Madrid improve?
content: Both Man United and Real Madrid abruptly fired their coaches without permanent replacements lined up, so "caretaker managers" will see out the season.

title: The Knicks, Nets and a crosstown friendship nearly two decades in the making
content: In 2009, Mike Brown met Jordi Fernandez and got him an internship with the Cavaliers. Seventeen years later, their relationship runs far deeper just than New York City basketball rivals.

title: 'Are you happy?': Cignetti's daughter revisits viral 2019 post after father's national title win
content: In 2019, Natalie asked her father if he was happy. He wasn't. Now, his answer to the same question is different.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona eye move for Álvarez
content: Barcelona are continuing to circle back on a potential move for Atlético Madrid's Julián Álvarez. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Transfer window weekly: Güler to Arsenal? Chelsea squad changes?
content: The winter transfer window is open, so what are our reporters hearing about deals that could be done?

title: Natalia Silva, Max Holloway can create UFC chaos immediately in 2026
content: Natalia Silva, Amanda Nunes, Max Holloway and more fighters who can derail 2026 UFC championship predictions.

title: UK: Hindu parents remove son from London primary school in row over tilak-chandlo
content: the boy was a pupil at Vicar’s Green Primary school in Alperton . staff told him the tilak-chandlo violated the uniform code . he was reportedly asked to “explain and justify” his religious practice .

title: WEF 2026: Adani Group sets out ₹6 lakh crore investment blueprint for India
content: The Adani Group said the investments span Maharashtra, Assam and Jharkhand and reflect a strategic shift from standalone asset creation to integrated, technology-led infrastructure platforms

title: AI labelling rules nearing finalisation, says IT Secretary S. Krishnan
content: In October, the government had proposed changes to IT rules, mandating the clear labelling of AI-generated content and increasing the accountability of large platforms like Facebook and YouTube

title: APMC to build state-of-the-art fruit and vegetable market at Singena Agrahara in Bengaluru
content: Government mulling over shifting Kalasipalya vegetable market to Singena Agrahara, trade of perishables in Yeshwantpur APMC yard to be shifted to Dasanapura

title: Country is in a dangerous shift from cooperative federalism to coercive centralism, Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah
content: Socialist thoughts are deeply rooted in the political history of Karnataka, Siddaramaiah said, adding that it has shaped Karnataka’s governance culture

title: Kerala Assembly polls: UDF eyes Dalit thinker Sunny M. Kapikad to challenge LDF hold in Vaikom
content: When contacted, Kapikad confirmed that informal discussions have taken place regarding his possible candidature, though he said no formal communication has been received from the UDF leadership

title: All land measurement issues will be disposed of by January 31: Nitish Kumar
content: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar directed the Revenue and Land Reforms Department to make necessary arrangements for adequate manpower and resources, along with ensuring intensive monitoring of the entire process

title: Seven fishermen arrested by Sri Lankan Navy off Kodiyakkarai
content: The fishermen were taken into custody along with the boats for allegedly fishing across the maritime boundary

title: 36 personnel, including 32 students injured in road mishap near Rajamahendravaram in A.P.
content: The students and teachers of Government Model High School, Gundlapalli, in Nalgonda District of Telangana State were travelling in the two buses as part of an excursion trip

title: Wayanad landslides compensation: HC seeks stance of Centre, State
content: The petitioners have sought compensation for their land under the Right to Fair Compensation and Transparency in Land Acquisition, Rehabilitation and Resettlement Act, 2013, along with appropriate rehabilitation measures

title: Saved banyans of Chevella burn again
content: A survey by the Nature Lovers Group then put the total number of trees burnt, damaged and uprooted at 101

title: Warring couples can’t be allowed to settle their scores by treating courts as battlefield: Supreme Court
content: A Bench of Justices Rajesh Bindal and Manmohan made the observations while dissolving a marriage between the couple who stayed together only for 65 days and have been separated for over a decade

title: H-NEW holds counselling session for drug consumers and their families in Hyderabad
content: The primary objective of the session was to sensitise parents to the harmful effects of drug abuse, help them recognise early warning signs of substance dependency and emphasise the critical role of family support in rehabilitation

title: Charter of rights for People Living with HIV and ART to be placed before State HIV conclave
content: The proposed charter seeks to ensure dignity and non-discrimination, privacy and confidentiality of HIV status, access to comprehensive health services, and functional accountability mechanisms across government departments

title: CCB arrests Nigerian national, recover synthetic drugs worth ₹5.15 crore
content: The police are now trying to track down the source of the drugs and possible involvement of others in the crime

title: BDA@50: Why BDA’s foray into apartment housing has delivered uneven results
content: In many cases, basic infrastructure such as approach roads, drainage networks and reliable public transport lagged behind construction, diminishing the attractiveness of the flats despite lower prices

title: The darker side of Madras in the 1860s
content: Prison life today is often spoken of in hushed terms, where those inside manage to get what they want, from narcotics to deadly weapons. It is interesting that it was no different in the 1860s.

title: On the approach, outlook of Tamil Nadu’s Scheduled Caste leaders in late 1940s
content: In the 1946 elections to various provinces, the Congress demonstrated its superiority over the Scheduled Castes Federation (SCF) founded by B.R. Ambedkar. In the erstwhile Madras Presidency, the party bagged 27 out of 30 seats allotted to SCs.

title: Narrating stories of the world’s women mathematicians, in portraits
content: Woman in mathematics often find themselves up against a formidable glass ceiling. A new exhibition opens a window into the lives of 20 extraordinary women academics, including one from India

title: Chennai’s iconic annual fair at Island Grounds turns 50
content: The 70-day-long India Tourism and Industrial Fair that began at the Island Grounds in the city recently turned 50 this year. The Sutrula Porutkatchi was conceived and named by former Chief Minister M. Karunanidhi. It began in the city in 1974 as the ‘Pongal Tourist Trade Fair.’

title: SIT notice on Harish Rao is an attention diversion tactics: KTR
content: Rama Rao also questioned the silence of Union Coal Minister G. Kishan Reddy in the matter and sought to know whether the BJP was also party to the scam

title: National record holder pole vaulter, coach forced by Railways to pay to travel with kits
content: Coach Ghanshyam said that pole vault poles are nearly five metres long and cannot fit into a luggage van without the risk of damage

title: India gifts first tranche of 60 pick-up vehicles to Nepal for March 5 polls
content: The vehicles and other supplies gifted by India are part of the support requested by the Nepal government

title: India among Russia's top foreign trade partners: PM Mishustin
content: In the financial year 2024–25, total India-Russia trade reached an all-time high of about $68.7 billion, up sharply from roughly $13 billion in 2021, marking nearly a five - to six- fold increase over four years.

title: DMK’s allies criticise Governor; AMMK, PMK critique T.N. government’s prepared address to House
content: K. Selvaperunthagai, president of the Tamil Nadu Congress Committee, said the Governor’s action amounted to an insult to the Indian Constitution, the dignity of the Legislature, and the democratically elected Members of the Legislative Assembly

title: Governor’s address commends Tamil Nadu government, Chief Minister’s leadership
content: The address also lauds the “dynamic leadership” of the Deputy Chief Minister over the self-help group movement

title: Governor’s address flags ‘grave concern’ over Centre’s adverse attitude towards T.N. over fund release
content: It points to the continued denial of approvals and financial allocations for several essential projects

title: Not hesitant to commit to alliance with DMK, but discussions must begin, says Congress leader Girish Chodankar
content: Congress leader participates in the executive committee meeting of Tamil Nadu Congress Committee to discuss the preparatory work for the election campaign and the public rallies involving party leaders Mallikarjun Kharge, Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi

title: Madras HC quashes FIR against BJP leader Amit Malviya, says Udhayanidhi’s remarks on Sanatana Dharma are ‘hate speech’
content: The judge said the party to which Mr. Udhayanidhi belongs had repeatedly made statements against Sanatana Dharma, and hence, the overall circumstances leading to the present case ought to be taken into consideration

title: Sold-out hotels, packed flights: How India is becoming a global concert destination
content: the year 2026 is packed with events and shows that bring the musical soul of fans to life . the rock septet is also set to perform at Lollapalooza 2026, supercharged with other headliners like Playboi Carti, Fuji Kaze, and many more .

title: Mumbai road crash: Auto driver hurt as Mercedes collides with Akshay Kumar’s escort vehicle
content: an auto driver was injured after a Mercedes rammed into a threewheeler at Juhu . the rickshaw was piloting actor Akshay Kumar's vehicle as part of his security . police are yet to register an FIR and have got the auto driver admitted .

title: Palghar long march: Won’t go home without land ownership, say protesters
content: Their demands include land ownership under Forest Rights Act, removal of smart meters, and cancellation of the Vadhavan project in Dahanu, a coastal region of Palghar.

title: India withdraws families, dependents of diplomats and officials from all missions in Bangladesh
content: A source says the evacuation was carried out “given the security situation, as a precautionary measure”

title: KDRB moves SC against HC annulment of its power of appointment to Guruvayur Devaswom
content: The KDRB has submitted that its functions were limited to affairs of recruitment and did not intervene in the religious duties concerning temples

title: Mobs vandalise BDO offices as violent protests against SIR continue in West Bengal
content: Protests erupt a day after SC observation that SIR should be transparent, not cause inconvenience; BJP, TMC supporters clash over Form 7 submissions

title: SIR order was legislative, approach liberal, Election Commission tells Supreme Court
content: Countering attacks that the SIR did not have any statutory backing and the poll panel invented the procedure out of “thin air”, the EC said Article 324 provided it with the freedom to prepare the electoral roll

title: Draft Seeds Bill promotes private monopoly: Kisan Sabha
content: The priority should have been to ensure affordable quality seeds, and planting material with an emphasis on price control, the Kisan Sabha said

title: High-level State govt. panel to probe Indore water tragedy
content: The committee will conduct a detailed review of the events surrounding contaminated water supply in Indore city, and determine the accountability of staff responsible for the incident

title: Modi systematically strangling protections for poor, diverting resources: Rahul Gandhi
content: At an MGNREGA choupal in his constituency, the LoP accuses the BJP of undermining the scheme, diverting funds meant for workers, women, and the poor to big industrialists like Adani and Ambani.

title: Vinod Tawde to be BJP’s poll in-charge for Kerala, Ram Madhav for Bengaluru civic election
content: BJP president Nitin Nabin makes his first organisational appointments on the day he took charge as the party’s chief; Mr. Tawde has also been given charge of overseeing election of a new mayor for Chandigarh

title: SC sets aside HC order for CBI probe into Ambience Mall project
content: Top court says High Court direction was ex facie erroneous; clarifies other proceedings will continue

title: Summoning of journalists in J&K is a concern, says Congress
content: AICC in-charge for Jammu and Kashmir, Syed Naseer Hussain, said a democratic society could not function if “the basic act of asking questions is treated as an act of defiance”.  Congress flags reports of journalists being summoned in J&K over “routine reporting”

title: Fisheries Ministry to meet envoys to find new seafood export markets
content: Ambassadors and High Commissioners from about 80 countries to attend a “Fisheries Round Table” organised by the  Ministry

title: Contest for name, logo for new liquor brand: HC issues notice to govt., Bevco
content: The Kerala Catholic Bishops’ Council had criticised the naming contest, describing it as a form of surrogate advertising for liquor and warning that it could send a wrong message to society

title: ‘Serious’ about dog feeder liability, says SC as animal groups warn of ‘unfortunate’ outcomes
content: The three-judge Bench makes the observation after advocate Prashant Bhushan, appearing for an intervener, submits that he was under the impression that the Bench’s earlier remark on fixing accountability on dog feeders was made ‘sarcastically’ and could therefore be ‘misinterpreted’

title: Five arrested in Rajasthan over large-scale irregularities in exam held by Staff Selection Board
content: The accused, including the then Deputy Director and system programmer of the State Staff Selection Board, allegedly manipulated the OMR sheets in the exams; 3,212 posts were advertised under the exams, for which over 9.40 lakh candidates had applied

title: Kerala SIR: KPCC seeks to publish names on ‘logical discrepancy’ list
content: MLA Mathew Kuzhalnadan hands over a letter to Chief Electoral Officer (Kerala) Rathan U. Kelkar in this regard

title: A.P. CM Naidu pushes for AI and startup growth initiatives at Davos meet
content: Naidu meets global technology leaders and outlines vision to transform Andhra Pradesh as a knowledge economy and innovation-driven State

title: KSRTC commuters to get real-time bus tracking through VTMS soon
content: The Central Control Station, which will be located at the Mysuru Road Satellite Bus Station in Bengaluru, will function as the nerve centre of the VTMS

title: It is the duty of all Left, democratic forces to hold high the flag of democracy: CPI (M) general secretary M A Baby
content: The false narratives of the fascist RSS backed forces need to be countered and relentless efforts be made to strengthen independent Left organisations to jointly combat the communal and fascist forces, Mr. Baby said

title: FCV tobacco farmers urge Centre to review hike in cigarette tax
content: The ‘sudden tax shock’ is likely to contract demand for legal cigarettes, leading to lower auction prices of tobacco, weak buyer participation, unsold stocks and growing distress among farmers, says Federation of All India Farmers’ Associations

title: Ex-CAPF officials file contempt plea against Home Secretary for not implementing Supreme Court order
content: The top couordered progressive reduction of the IPS deputation in CAPFs up to the level of IGs in the next two years and sought a time-bound review of cadre and service rules in six months

title: Blue Monday: Why Marc Guéhi joining Man City leaves Liverpool in a mess
content: the third Monday of January has been widely dubbed "Blue Monday" for more than two decades . skeptics would argue the occasion is nothing more than a marketing ploy . liverpool fans will certainly have felt glum on Monday afternoon after marc Guéhi's transfer .

title: Sunita Williams Retires From NASA After 3 Missions, 608 Days In Space
content: The retirement, announced by NASA on Tuesday, came into effect just after last Christmas, on December 27, 2025.

title: Scammers Dupe Billionaires Seeking Access To Donald Trump In Davos
content: In a post on the venue's website, the organisers warned against the purchase of so-called VIP access packages and said the fraudulent sales appear to be widespread this year.

title: World Order In "Midst Of A Rupture": Canada PM At Davos
content: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney said Tuesday that the USled global system of governance is enduring "a rupture," defined by great power competition and a "fading" rulesbased order.

title: Delhi Approves Free LPG Cylinder For Poor Households Ahead Of Holi
content: The Delhi government has cleared a major relief measure for economically weaker households, approving a scheme to provide one free LPG cooking gas cylinder ahead of Holi.

title: "Would Not Be Wise": US Warns Against EU Tariff 'Bazooka' Over Greenland
content: The US trade envoy on Tuesday warned European nations against using its tariff "bazooka" in response to President Donald Trump's threat to acquire Greenland, saying it would "not be wise".

title: Japan Court To Rule Today In Ex-PM Shinzo Abe Assassination Case
content: A Japanese court will on Wednesday deliver its verdict on a man accused of fatally shooting former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe, three and a half years after the assassination of the country's longest-serving premier stunned the nation.

title: Australia Passes Anti-Hate Speech, Gun Laws After Sydney Attack
content: Australia's Prime Minister Anthony Albanese on Wednesday welcomed Parliament's passing of anti-hate speech and gun laws in response to two shooters killing 15 people at a Jewish festival in Sydney last month.

title: "You'll Find Out": Trump On How Far He Would Go To Acquire Greenland
content: US President Donald Trump refused Tuesday to say how far he will go on Greenland but suggested that he could make a deal as European leaders voice alarm over his threats to seize the territory from ally Denmark.

title: "Saved Millions Of People, Should Have Gotten Nobel": Trump Targets Norway
content: US President Donald Trump expressed disappointment over not receiving the Nobel Peace Prize last year, claiming that he should've been awarded the prize for stopping each of the "eight" wars.

title: Supreme Court Declines To Interfere In Sameer Wankhede Promotion
content: The Supreme Court refused to interfere with the Delhi High Court's decision that upheld a ruling passed by the Central Administrative Tribunal (CAT) granting relief to IRS Sameer Wankhede by directing the Centre to proceed with his promotion.

title: JD Vance, US Second Lady Usha Say They Are Expecting Fourth Child
content: Vice President JD Vance and his wife, second lady Usha Vance, are expecting a son in late July, they announced in a social media post on Tuesday.

title: US To Cut Roughly 200 NATO Positions Amid Trump's Greenland Threats: Report
content: The US plans to reduce the number of personnel it has stationed within several key NATO command centers, a move that could intensify concerns in Europe about Washington's commitment to the alliance, three sources familiar with the matter said.

title: Trump Considers Role In Venezuela For Opposition Leader Machado
content: President Donald Trump said on Tuesday he was considering involving Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado in some capacity in her country, but did not say what role she could play.

title: Trump Says Wouldn't Join Paris G7 Meeting Suggested By Macron
content: US President Donald Trump on Tuesday said he would not attend an emergency meeting of G7 nations to discuss the war in Ukraine that was proposed by French President Emmanuel Macron.

title: Stone Thrown During Parents' Fight Kills 4-Year-Old Son; Case Filed: Cops
content: A quarrel between a couple turned fatal when a stone thrown during the fight accidentally hit their 4-year-old son, killing him, police said on Tuesday.

title: Ukraine's Chornobyl Nuclear Plant Lost All Power After Russia Attack: UN Watchdog
content: Ukraine's Chornobyl nuclear power plant, site of the world's worst civil nuclear catastrophe, lost all off-site power following widespread military activity on Tuesday morning, the UN atomic watchdog said in a post on X.

title: Inspira Global To Acquire Stake In Burger King India After Everstone Exit
content: Restaurant Brands Asia said on Tuesday that Inspira Global will acquire a controlling stake in the Burger King India and Indonesia operator for around 4.60 billion rupees ($50.54 million).

title: Amid Fury Over Techie Drowning, Delhi Accident Data Exposes Urban Safety Gaps
content: The death of a young software engineer who drowned in a waterlogged pit in Noida has once again raised alarm over urban safety in the national capital region.

title: Ukraine Parliament Without Power, Water After Russian Strike
content: Russian overnight strikes on Ukraine's energy grid has left the parliament building in Kyiv without electricity, heating and water.

title: UAE President Accepts US Invitation To Join Trump's 'Board of Peace'
content: The UAE's president has accepted an invitation to join US President Donald Trump's "Board of Peace", the foreign ministry said Tuesday, the body meant to oversee post-war reconstruction in Gaza.

title: Indiana -- yes, Indiana! -- is the national champ! How Curt Cignetti and the Hoosiers did it
content: a year ago, it felt hard to believe the losingest program in FBS history would have much staying power . critics ripped their schedule, called them a fluke, debated whether they even deserved to make the college football Playoff . they should leave the real football to the real blue bloods . the man simply does not lose .

title: 'General soreness': Warriors' Butler brings back viral meme after tearing right ACL
content: he posted an edited photo of him dressed in military-style attire with a message written above it: "general soreness" the meme went viral during the 2018-19 season, which coincided with Butler requesting a trade from the Minnesota Timberwolves in September 2018 .

title: How Jannik Sinner has changed his game since the US Open
content: Jannik Sinner won two of the four majors in 2025 and was within one point of a third . he has won seven of their past nine meetings . but he says he was very predictable today . Sinner is tipped to become a better player .

title: 💯 Arizona high schooler breaks scoring record
content: Adrian Stubbs needed just three quarters to drop 100 points in 109-25 victory at Yuma Kofa . the 5-foot-10 guard broke the previous record of 75 points held by George McCormick since 1966 . he's not on a short list for can't-miss NIL targets for major companies .

title: Which injuries will have the biggest impact on the Olympic hockey tournament?
content: leo Carlsson is out three to five weeks with a thigh injury . the 21-year-old has 38 points through 29 games this season . he has been struggling recently to the tune of six points in 15 games .

title: NBA buzz: What now for Golden State after Jimmy Butler's injury?
content: the trade deadline is Feb. 5 at 3 p.m. ET, and we have you covered on all the buzz around the league as the 2025-26 season heats up . will the Memphis Grizzlies move on from Ja Morant after they've started to entertain offers .
